com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com santa sock monkey pattern pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies  size g hook  lion brand wool-ease yarn not the thick and chunky variety or similar weight o mushroom brown o aran off white or cream o small amounts of red o i used a different color of red for the hat and a white white for the trim but you can use the wool-ease if you want gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet chain = chain or chain stitch increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together note this pattern is worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic_ring be creative and have fun page 2 of 12 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com head row instruction stitches 1 using white 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each *single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 30 6 *single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 36 change to brown yarn at the
